hypothesis_content.title: Intraday Funding Rate Extremes as Contrarian Signal
hypothesis_content.statement: In NEUTRAL regimes, when the aggregate perpetual swap funding rate (8-hour average) exceeds +0.03% (annualized > +30%) or falls below -0.03%, and coincides with BTC price trading at the previous day's high/low (within 0.2%), a reversal toward the previous day's VWAP will occur within the next 6 hours with 70% probability.
hypothesis_content.rationale: Extreme funding in neutral regimes suggests leveraged crowd positioning at obvious technical levels (previous day high/low). This creates a 'squeeze setup' where price is extended from fair value (VWAP) and positioned one-way. Reversion to VWAP represents liquidation of these extreme positions.
entry_conditions: BTC price within 0.2% of previous day's high (for short) or low (for long)
BTC price >1.0% away from previous day's VWAP
Entry: Limit order at previous day's high/low (adjusted for funding direction)

exit_conditions.take_profit: Price returns to within 0.3% of previous day's VWAP
exit_conditions.stop_loss: Price moves 0.8% beyond previous day's high/low in the unfavorable direction

hypothesis_content.falsification_criteria: Price continues through previous day's high/low with extreme funding more than 50% of signals, indicating trending behavior rather than mean reversion.
